Posts.Content: Hi, I finished my chemo at the end of July this year and have also completed radiotherapy.  I am still suffering a bit of numbness in my toes and balls of feet and this is making my feet sore when I go walking which I am doing to keep up my spirits and energy. Has anyone else suffered this and found a good solution? I was thinking of buying some gel insoles in the hope they might work. Any tips will be gratefully received, Thanks
Posts.Title: Sore Feet/ peripheral neuropathy

Posts.Content: Thanks Carolyn28, I will give these things a try. I love walking so I am finding it frustrating at the moment.  How long ago did you finish your chemo?  Xxx
Posts.Title: Sore Feet/ peripheral neuropathy

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for all the advice, I shall be trying it out. Are there any makes of gel insoles that you recommend above others Baki? Xxx
Posts.Title: Sore Feet/ peripheral neuropathy

Posts.Content: My heels are not really a problem, it is mainly the balls of my feet. So probably full insoles. I was wondering about the 'party feet' gel pads but a full insole would probably be more comfy. Xxx
Posts.Title: Sore Feet/ peripheral neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi Rach, I asked for a Picc line to be fitted as no one had offered it,  and it was the best thing I did after having problems with my veins. Had it fitted for chemo 4 out of 6 and wish I had it from the beginning. It didn't hurt to be fitted, and I can't feel it there. The weekly flush is quick and painless, and nice to get clean dressings on. I put a cut off sock over the dressing to disguise it, people think it's a running band and comment how trendy it looks!! Good luck with it X
Posts.Title: Picc line for chemo

Posts.Content: Hi, I had discomfort in my chest and neck area for about a week after my Picc line was inserted. I went to a&e to get checked for any clots but this was all fine. It settled down after a week and I can't feel anything now, so glad I asked for it to be fitted. It was fitted on my non surgery side. Hope yours settles down very quickly and your checks are all good, Take care
Posts.Title: Why is my PICC a Pain...???

Posts.Content: Hi, I bought some really nice bandanas that I have been complimented on from Annabandana. I got them through Amazon as they were each less than £5 with free postage and arrived really quickly.  Worth taking a look, take care
Posts.Title: Head scarf/turbin

Posts.Content: Oops, sorry , chemo brain!! I got them through their site via EBAY!!!
